I agree, but I need to mention that some domains do not require 
setting up=
 a substrate at all. Consider the drawing of a picture and 
transforming it=
 to a physics object, of just "drawing" the properties 
of a static object.=
 Well this is just CPPN stuff, not involving 
HyperNEAT, which evolves expl=
icitly neural networks. 

Hm.. There is one thing I want to ask about it. I=
n Picbreeder for 
example, both -1 and 1 is considered white, right? Is thi=
s the reason 
behind the fact that I can evolve negative-like images as eas=
y as 
normal ones? 

I am asking this because in Alife domains, I don't wan=
t creatures 
that are just a sea of tissue and empty space in the center to=
 
appear. Is there a way to avoid that? Maybe is the total amount of 
tissu=
e exceeds a certain limit, to turn the picture negative, or what?

Peter

-=
